subject: Negotiation
title: Time as a Weapon
description: A micro-lesson that makes Time as a Weapon usable.

hook.text: The side under more time pressure makes worse deals. Every deadline is a transfer of power.

buildup.text: Time pressure forces decisions before all information is gathered and all options are explored.

discovery.text: The party that can afford to wait has a structural advantage â€” patience becomes leverage.

twist.text: Skilled negotiators create time pressure for the other side while hiding their own deadlines.

climax.text: Never reveal your deadline. Always try to learn theirs. That asymmetry is pure power.

punchline.text: The clock is a weapon. Make sure it's pointed at them, not you.

quiz.question: Why is hiding your deadline important in negotiation?
options: Revealing your deadline transfers power to the other side
Hiding deadlines is dishonest and should be avoided
